| runtime        = 276 minutes<ref name=AVNReview/>

}}

'''''The Fashionistas''''' is a 2002 [[pornographic film]] directed by [[John Stagliano]] and produced by [[Evil Angel (studio)|Evil Angel Productions]]. Shot on 35&nbsp;mm film, it was a high-budget production (with a budget of about $500,000),<ref name=brio>"Style and Substance: Fashionistas hits its tenth anniversary", ''[[AVN (magazine)|AVN Magazine]]'', Vol. 29/No. 2, Issue 362, February 2013, pp. 46–51.</ref> with a length of over four and a half hours. The film was a commercial success, selling over 100,000 copies just in its first month of release.<ref name=brio/> In 2003, it set the record for most [[AVN Award]] nominations for a single title — 22.<ref name=AVNReview/>

''Fashionistas'' also marks the American debut of [[Manuel Ferrara]].<ref name="Vice">[https://www.vice.com/fr/article/le-porno-cet-ocean-v9n3 Le porno, cet océan], ''[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]'', 24 March 2015</ref> The film has had two sequels, ''Fashionistas Safado: The Challenge'' and ''Fashionistas Safado: Berlin'', both still directed by Stagliano.<ref name=brio/> Siffredi, Belladonna and Ferrara reprised their roles in the sequels, which also starred [[Katsuni]] and [[Nacho Vidal]].

==Plot==
The Fashionistas are an up-and-coming group of [[fetish fashion]] designers led by Helena ([[Taylor St. Claire]]) and based in the [[Fashion District, Los Angeles|Fashion District of Los Angeles]].<ref name=AVNReview/> The group is trying to land a deal with Italian fetish fashion designer Antonio ([[Rocco Siffredi]]).<ref name=AVNReview/> Antonio, who recently divorced amid highly publicized rumors of extramarital affairs, arrives in [[Los Angeles]] in search of an [[Sadomasochism|s/m]]-influenced house to partner with.<ref>{{cite news|url= http://www.villagevoice.com/2003-04-01/people/the-best-porno-of-the-year/full/|title= The Best Porno of the Year?|accessdate= 2014-12-11|author= Johnny Maldoro|date= 2003-04-01|newspaper= [[The Village Voice]]}}</ref> In order to grab Antonio's attention, the Fashionistas crash his fashion show.<ref name=AVNReview/> Helena wants Antonio to believe she is the creative force behind the Fashionistas, even though it is actually Jesse ([[Belladonna (actress)|Belladonna]]), her assistant.<ref name=AVNReview/> Jesse also engages in a triangular relation with Helena and Antonio.<ref name=brio/>

==Live show==
There was also a theatrical dance show based on the film called ''The Fashionistas Live Show'' at the Krave nightclub at [[The Aladdin]] in Las Vegas. The show ran from
October 12, 2004 to February 28, 2008<ref name="fashionistastheshow">{{cite web |url=http://fashionistastheshow.com/index.html |title=Las Vegas Show - John Stagliano's Fashionistas Website |access-date=2016-03-29 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160322020720/http://www.fashionistastheshow.com/index.html |archive-date=2016-03-22 |url-status=dead }}</ref> and
won the '[[AVN (magazine)|AVN]] Special Achievement Award' in 2006.<ref>{{cite magazine|url= http://business.avn.com/articles/video/2006-AVN-Award-Winners-Announced-47237.html|title= 2006 AVN Award Winners Announced|accessdate= 2014-12-06|date= 2006-01-09|magazine= [[AVN (magazine)|AVN]]}}</ref>
